vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἐκδῐκ-έω,
avenge, punish, φόνον [NT+5th c.BC+]; exact vengeance for, τὰ αἵματα τῶν δούλων [LXX+2nd c.BC+]
__2 decide a case, δίκην, ἀγῶνα, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__II avenge or vindicate a person, by taking up his cause, [NT+1st c.AD+]; ἐ. τινὰ ἀπό τινος avenge one on another, [NT+5th c.BC+]:—passive, [LXX]
__II.2 act as ἔκδικος [Refs 1st c.BC+]
__III claim, [Refs 5th c.AD+]
__IV ἐ. τισί make retribution for them, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to avenge, take revenge; to grant justice, get justice
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to avenge, take revenge; to grant justice, get justice
primarily to execute right and justice; to punish, 2Cor. 10:6; Rev. 6:10; 19:2; in NT to right, avenge a person, Lk. 18:3, 5; Rom. 12:9*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: vengarse, ayudar (a alguien) a conseguir justicia ; vengar, castigar, tomar venganza (ROM.12:19)
